If you are asking about a No Objection Certificate (NOC) for an employee to leave a company, it is typically a letter issued by the employer stating that they have no objection to the employee leaving the company for a specified reason. The letter usually contains the following information:

1. Employee's name and designation.
2. Reason for leaving the company.
3. Date of termination of employment or last working day.
4. Any pending dues to be paid to the employee.
5. Confirmation that the employee has returned all company property, if applicable.
6. Signature of the authorized person from the company.

The format and wording of the NOC may vary depending on the company's policies and the reason for the employee leaving. It is best to consult with the HR department or the employee's supervisor to obtain the correct format and details for the NOC.

Sure, here's a sample No Objection Certificate (NOC) that can be used for an employee leaving a company:

[Date]

To Whom It May Concern,

This is to certify that [Employee Name], who has been working as [Employee Designation] at [Company Name], has submitted his/her resignation on [Resignation Date] and will be relieved from his/her duties on [Last Working Day].

We confirm that we have no objection to the employee leaving the company and wish him/her all the best in their future endeavors.

Furthermore, we certify that there are no pending dues to be paid to the employee, and all company property has been returned.

We appreciate the services rendered by [Employee Name] during his/her tenure with us and thank him/her for the contributions made towards the growth of our organization.

Sincerely,

[Authorized Signatory]
[Company Name]

[Date]

To Whom It May Concern,

This letter is to certify that [Employee Name], who is currently employed with [Company Name] as [Employee Designation], has been granted permission to apply for a work visa in Canada to work as [Job Title] for [Client/Customer Name] in [City/Province], Canada.

We confirm that we have no objection to [Employee Name] applying for a work visa and working in Canada. We fully support his/her decision to explore international job opportunities and believe that this experience will help him/her grow both professionally and personally.

[Employee Name] has been a valuable asset to our organization, and we believe that his/her skills, knowledge, and expertise will be a great addition to [Client/Customer Name] in Canada. We are confident that he/she will represent our organization positively and uphold the highest standards of professionalism and integrity.

We certify that [Employee Name] is a current employee of [Company Name], and there are no pending dues or obligations to be fulfilled by him/her before leaving for Canada. We further confirm that we have no objection to his/her employment with [Client/Customer Name] and that we will provide any necessary support and documentation as required.

We wish [Employee Name] all the best for his/her new endeavor in Canada and hope that he/she will have a successful and fulfilling experience.

Sincerely,

[Authorized Signatory]
[Company Name]
